section.title: View Diameter Stack Version and State
section.para: In the top, at the summary section the Type, Version and State of the &THIS.PLATFORM; Diameter is shown.

section.title: Monitor Diameter Stack Availability over time
section.para: By accessing the MONITOR tab it's possible to see a graph showing the availability of the Diameter stack over time.

section.title: View Diameter Stack Components
section.para: By accessing the INVENTORY tab a table presenting the stack components (Local Peer, Network Peers and Realms) and their availability is shown.

note.title: Configuration changed outside &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM;
note.para: If peers or realms are added/removed outside &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM;, after &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Agent is started, the list of components will not be updated in a reasonable time.
For performance reasons, &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; servers childs (such as Local Peer, Network Peers and Realms in Diameter) are checked for changes every 24 hours.

section.para: To force a service discovery, there are two options:

listitem.para: In the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; web app, right-click the root item (Platform) of the &THIS.PLATFORM; Diameter and select Execute OperationManual Autodiscovery. Select Yes in Detailed Discovery and run the discovery by clicking the SCHEDULE button.
In the &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; agent console, run a full discovery, by issuing the following command:> discovery -f

section.title: Add/Remove Diameter Network Peers
section.para: In the INVENTORY tab it's possible to Add/Remove Diameter Network Peers.

section.title: Add a new Diameter Network Peer
section.para: In order to add a new Diameter Network Peer, select Network Peer on the Create New: option box and click OK, the following page will be shown:

figure.title: Adding a new Network Peer with &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Diameter Plugin.

textobject.para: Adding a new Network Peer with &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Diameter Plugin.

section.para: The following details are asked to be inputed for creating the new realm (fields with * are mandatory):

listitem.para: The Peer Name, as FQDN (eg: diameter.mobicents.org)
The Peer Rating, to be used as a priority when picking Realm peers.
Defines whether it should be attempted to connect to this peer (server peer) or rather wait for an incoming connection (client).

This defines the range of ports to be used by this peer when establishing connections.
Low Port Range
Define the low boundary for the port range.
High Port Range
Define the high boundary for the port range.
Defines the IP address to be used by this peer.

section.para: After filling all the mandatory (and optional, if desired) fields, click on the SUBMIT button. The success of the operation should be displayed on the main view.

section.title: Remove a Diameter Network Peer
section.para: To remove a Diameter Network Peer, simply check the desired network peer on the INVENTORY tab and press DELETE. A confirmation dialog be displayed. The success of the operation will be shown on the main view.

figure.title: Removing a Network Peer with &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Diameter Plugin.

textobject.para: Removing a Network Peer with &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Diameter Plugin.

section.title: Add/Remove Diameter Realms
section.para: In the INVENTORY tab it's possible to Add/Remove Diameter Realms.

section.title: Add a new Diameter Realm
section.para: In order to add a new Diameter Realm, select Realm on the Create New: option box and click OK, the following page will be shown:

figure.title: Adding a new Realm with &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Diameter Plugin.

textobject.para: Adding a new Realm with &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Diameter Plugin.

section.para: The following details are asked to be inputed for creating the new realm (fields with * are mandatory):

listitem.para: The Realm Name
A list of Peers' IP Addresses belonging to this Realm.

This defines the role of the Local Peer in this Realm:
LOCAL
Acts as normal peer in the Realm.
RELAY
Acts as relay agent in the Realm, used to forward messages to the proper destination.
PROXY
Acts as proxy agent in the Realm, used also to forward messages but unlike the relay agent, can modify the contents of the message.
REDIRECT
Acts as redirect agent in the Realm, used for finding the correct peer to deliver a message, using it's routing table.
Defines whether the realm is dynamic, ie, new peers will be added to the table as they connect.
Defines expire time for dynamic peers to be removed from Realm.
Defines the Application-Ids supported by this Realm. They should be defined with Vendor-Id plus Authorization and/or Accounting Application-Id.

section.para: After filling all the mandatory (and optional, if desired) fields, click on the SUBMIT button. The success of the operation should be displayed on the main view.

warning.title: Removing a Configuration Network Peer
warning.para: It is not possible to remove a Network Peer that hasn't been added in runtime, ie, a Network Peer present in the Diameter Stack Configuration file.

section.title: Configuration of &THIS.PLATFORM; Diameter Stack
section.para: Under the CONFIGURATION tab, it's possible to change several parameters of &THIS.PLATFORM; Diameter Stack. To start making changes, click the EDIT button:

figure.title: Configuring &THIS.PLATFORM; Diameter Stack with &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Diameter Plugin.

textobject.para: Configuring &THIS.PLATFORM; Diameter Stack with &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM; Diameter Plugin.

listitem.para: Defines whether to accept connections from unknown (not configured) peers.
Defines whether duplicate message detection is enabled or disabled.
Defines the time between which a message is considered duplicate (in ms).
Defines if the FQDN should be the URI (ie, aaa://FQDN:port). Some applications require it, but it's not considered in specifications.
Defines the maximum number of messages to be kept in queue, waiting for processing.
Defines the amount of time to wait before considering a request has timed out (in ms).
Defines the default amount of time to wait for stack to stop (in ms).
Defines the amount of time to wait for processing a CEA message (in ms).
Defines the amount of time to wait for processing a DWR message (in ms).
Defines the amount of time to wait for processing a DWA message (in ms).
Defines the amount of time to wait for processing a DPA message (in ms).
Defines the amount of time between failed retries to reconnect to a peer (in ms).
Defines the Thread pools and their sizes for various entities:
Entity for watching for overloaded peers.
Entity for general message processing.
Entity for processing message time calculation.
Entity for performing actions in REDIRECT mode.
Entity for controlling duplicate messages.
Entity for performing statistics gathering.
Entity for managing peer connections.
Defines the frequency with which statistics will be recorded in logger (in ms).
Defines the frequency with which statistics will be recorded in logger (in ms).

note.para: Not all values are changeable and are read-only (eg: DuplicateProtection).

section.para: When done editing the values, click on SAVE. In order to revert to the last saved values, click the RESET button.

section.title: Start &THIS.PLATFOTRM; Diameter Stack
section.para: Under the OPERATIONS tab, an operation for starting &THIS.PLATFOTRM; Diameter Stack, can be found: Start Stack.
This action takes no parameters.

note.para: As any operation on &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM;, this operation can be scheduled for a later time, have a defined timeout and/or include additional notes.

section.para: Clicking on the SCHEDULE executes (if Immediately is selected) or schedules the operation. After being executed, it's shown in HISTORY, Completed Operations. Clicking on its name shows the result(s).

section.title: Stop &THIS.PLATFOTRM; Diameter Stack
section.para: Under the OPERATIONS tab, an operation for stopping &THIS.PLATFOTRM; Diameter Stack, can be found: Stop Stack.
This action takes no parameters.

note.para: As any operation on &MANAGEMENT.PLATFORM;, this operation can be scheduled for a later time, have a defined timeout and/or include additional notes.

section.para: Clicking on the SCHEDULE executes (if Immediately is selected) or schedules the operation. After being executed, it's shown in HISTORY, Completed Operations. Clicking on its name shows the result(s).
